com.pb.sawdust.util.abacus

Class LockableAbacus

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pb.sawdust.util.abacus.Abacus
      • com.pb.sawdust.util.abacus.LockableAbacus
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Iterator<int[]>

    public class LockableAbacus
extends Abacus
    The LockableAbacus class provides an abacus whose dimensions may be fixed at a certain value. For example, if a lockable abacus is created with the dimensions 8,5,3 and the second dimension is locked at a value of 3, then the following states will start the iteration sequence of the abacus: 
         
         [0,3,0]
     
     
         [0,3,1]
     
     
         [0,3,2]
     
     
         [1,3,0]
     
     
         ...

    It is important to note that this class is not immutable, in that its dimensions are locked via a method, rather than at construction time. This allows the convenience of different lock configurations being built from fresh clones of a source lockable abacus. Once a dimension has been locked, the abacus's getLength() and getState() return values will change, as the number of iteration states will be reduced by the size of the locked dimension.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LockableAbacus

        public LockableAbacus(boolean reverse,
              int... dimensions)
        Constructor specifying the dimensions of the lockableabacus and its value precedence direction. If the reverse flag is set to false, then a "standard" abacus, where decreasing array indexes indicate increasing value precedence, will be built; if reverse is set to true, then the lower the array index, the lower the value precedence.
        Parameters:
        reverse - Flag indicating whether the value precedence should be reversed or not in the abacus.
        dimensions - The dimensions of the abacus. Each entry specifies the value at which a "rollover" occurs.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if dimensions.length == 0, or if any entry in dimensions is less than one.

      • LockableAbacus

        public LockableAbacus(int... dimensions)
        Constructor for a standard (non-reversed) lockable abacus specifying its dimensions.
        Parameters:
        dimensions - The dimensions of the abacus. Each entry specifies the value at which a "rollover" occurs.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if dimensions.length == 0, or if any entry in dimensions is less than one.

    • Method Detail

      • lockDimension

        public void lockDimension(int dimension,
                 int value)
        Lock a specified dimension to a value.
        Parameters:
        dimension - The dimension (0-based) to lock. If the dimension is already locked, this lock will replace the previous one.
        value - The value to lock dimension to.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if dimension is less than 0 or greater than or equal to the number of dimensions in the abacus, or if value is less than 0 or greater than or equal to the (initial) size of dimension.

      • freshClone

        public LockableAbacus freshClone()
        Get a new abacus with the same structure as this one set at its first positional state. This method does not affect this abacus. This method will return a LockableAbacus with the same dimensions locked (to the same values} as this abacus at the time this method is called. No connection between the clone and this abacus are retained after the clone is constructed (that is, subsequent dimension locks on this abacus are not transmitted to the clone).
        Overrides:
        freshClone in class Abacus
        Returns:
        a new clone of this abacus with its position state set to that in which now iterations have been performed.

      • getAbacusPoint

        public int[] getAbacusPoint(long iteratorPosition)
        Description copied from class: Abacus
        Get the array returned by this abacus after a given number of iterations. This method is more efficient than explicitly iterating through a fresh clone of this abacus, and thus can be useful in quickly getting a single position in this abacus's iteration cycle.
        Overrides:
        getAbacusPoint in class Abacus
        Parameters:
        iteratorPosition - The iteration position of interest.
        Returns:
        the abacus point at iterationPosition.

      • setAbacusPoint

        public void setAbacusPoint(int[] point)
        Set this abacus's state as if its last iteration step returned the specified element point.
        Overrides:
        setAbacusPoint in class Abacus
        Parameters:
        point - The point to set the abacus at.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the value of the locked dimensions in point do not equal the value that those dimensions were locked at.

      • getStateCount

        public long getStateCount()
        Description copied from class: Abacus
        Get the total number of unique states of this abacus. This may not be equal to the length of the abacus, in the case that the abacus returns duplicate states at different points in its iteration.
        Overrides:
        getStateCount in class Abacus
        Returns:
        the number of unique states of this abacus.
